Uses of Class
com.aeonium.javafx.validation.FXAbstractValidator

  • Packages that use FXAbstractValidator 
    Package Description
    com.aeonium.javafx.validation
    This package provides deklarative validation for JavaFX user interfaces with the following goals: A simple way of declaring validation constraints on a input field, an (at best) unobtrusive way of wiring submit controls to the validation.

    • Uses of FXAbstractValidator in com.aeonium.javafx.validation

      Subclasses of FXAbstractValidator in com.aeonium.javafx.validation 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  NotNullValidator
      Checks (currently only) choiceboxes and comboboxes whether they have a valid selection value not equaling null.
      class  NumberValidator
      Checks whether input of a text control may be parsed as a double precision number and optionally whether the value does not violate min an max range constraints.
      class  RequiredValidator
      Validate ttext input controls as "required", i.e., they must not be empty.
      class  StringValidator
      Check string input, e.g., whether it fits into min and max lengths.
      Fields in com.aeonium.javafx.validation with type parameters of type FXAbstractValidator 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.util.Map<javafx.scene.control.Control,java.util.List<FXAbstractValidator>> ValidatorService.validatorMap
      Mapping of multiple validators to it's control.
